intro: Sauvagesia insolita, commonly known as the wild hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
